greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows where T(n,k) is the number of labeled simple connected graphs with n vertices and exactly k bridges.
comment: A bridge is an edge that, if removed without removing any incident vertices, disconnects the graph. Connected graphs with no bridges are counted by A095983 (2-edge-connected graphs).
Warning: In order to be consistent with A001187, we have treated the n = 0 and n = 1 cases in ways that are not consistent with A095983.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1325
Gus Wiseman, The 10 + 12 + 16 graphs counted in row n = 4.
program: T(n)={my(p=x*deriv(log(sum(k=0, n, 2^binomial(k, 2) * x^k / k!) + O(x*x^n))), v=Vec(1+serreverse(serreverse(log(x/serreverse(x*exp(p))))/exp(x*y+O(x^n))))); vector(#v, k, max(0,k-2)!*Vecrev(v[k], k)) }
xref: Column k = 0 is A095983, if we assume A095983(0) = A095983(1) = 1.
Row sums without the first column are A327071.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Aug 24 2019
ext: Terms a(21) and beyond from _Andrew Howroyd_, Dec 28 2020
